newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares dive 2.2 pct in major profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares dive 2.2 pct in major profit-taking.

text.p: Istanbul shares fell sharply in consolidation on Tuesday following the recent sharp gains, but recovered slightly on fresh support, brokers said.

The IMKB-100 ended at 81,504.41, down 1,796.55 points, or 2.16 percent from Monday's all-time high close of 83,300.96. Trade volume plunged to 17.30 trillion lira ($181.5 million) from Monday's record high 28.83 trillion ($302.5 million).

"Today's profit-taking was a normal technical development and it may continue tomorrow. If the index falls some more, it may touch 78,000 levels before turning up again," said Murat Emrali from Eczacibasi securities.

Brokers expect selective demand to be fuelled by nine-month profit prospects in coming days. Companies have to release their nine-month financial reports by October 25 the latest and banks by November 8.
The index had surged 28.6 percent from September 13 to Monday, breaking nine record closes in the strong medium-term uptrend which began with the breaching of 65,000 barrier.
